title: American Ballet Theatre at the Met
subject_group: Music & Performing Arts/Ballets - Film and video adaptations
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television adaptations
abstract: Les Sylphides (29:00 mins)--Sylvia (15:00 mins)--Triad - Pas de deux (25:00 mins)--Paquita (27:00 mins)
description: These three wonderful ballets plus a pas de deux were performed by the American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, New York, on 11 June 1984. Les Sylphides: Music by Frideric Chopin, choreography by Michel Fokine, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Mikhail Baryshnikov, Cynthia Harvey, Marianna Tcherkassky, Cheryl Yeager. Sylvia: Music by Leo Delibes, choreography by George Balanchine, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Patrick Bissell, Martina Van Hamel. Triad: Music by Serge Prokofiev, choreography by Kenneth MacMillan, conducted by Alan Barker with violin solo by Dennis Cleveland and featuring dancers Robert La Fosse, Amanda McKerrow, Johan Renvall. Paquita: Music by Ludwig Minkus, choreography by Natalia Makarova, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Fernando Bujones, Cynthia Gregory.
